name: poshness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being expensive and of high quality
UK the quality of being from a high social class: Although he prided himself on his poshness, he was at heart spectacularly vulgar. See
posh
More examplesFewer examplesWill the building's fine architecture, lovely setting and former poshness be enough to attract visitors?The big Victorian houses and terraces peak, for poshness, round Gordon Square and Windsor Crescent. Fashion colleges don't pick students in direct proportion to the poshness of their school.The poshness of leading Tories has not been fatal to the party's appeal so far.He is a posh boy with a hostility to poshness. Woodall and Constantine are unapologetic about their poshness.
